references.paper_title: Identification of partially observed linear causal models: Graphical conditions for the non-gaussian and heterogeneous cases
references.reason: This paper establishes graphical conditions for identifying partially observed linear causal models in both non-Gaussian and heterogeneous settings, advancing the understanding of causal inference under more realistic data conditions.

references.paper_title: Recursive causal structure learning in the presence of latent variables and selection bias
references.reason: This work addresses the challenge of causal structure learning when dealing with latent variables and selection bias, which commonly occur in real-world data.

references.paper_title: Learning linear Bayesian networks with latent variables
references.reason: This foundational paper introduces methods for learning linear Bayesian networks with latent variables, which is directly relevant to the identification problem tackled in the current work.

references.paper_title: Combining graphical and algebraic approaches for parameter identification in latent variable structural equation models
references.reason: This paper combines graphical and algebraic approaches to parameter identification, providing a comprehensive strategy that addresses the limitations of purely graphical or algebraic methods.

references.paper_title: Half-trek criterion for identifiability of latent variable models
references.reason: This paper introduces the half-trek criterion, a novel graphical condition for determining the identifiability of parameters in latent variable models, contributing to the theoretical foundations of causal discovery.
